briefTitle: Treatment of Multiple Attacks of Acute Migraine (0462-025)

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Patient had at least a 6-month history of migraine, with or without aura
* Patient was male, or if female must have been postmenopausal, surgically sterilized, or taking adequate contraceptive precautions.
* Patient was judged to be in good health, apart from migraine

Exclusion Criteria:

* Patient was pregnant or a nursing mother.
* Patient had abused drugs or alcohol within 12 months prior to entering the study
* Patient had a history of cardiovascular disease
* Patient had clinically significant ECG abnormality
* Patient had a resting systolic blood pressure of greater than 145 mm Hg or diastolic of less than 95 mm Hg at screening
* Patient received treatment with an investigational device or compound within 30 days of the study start
* Patient typically suffered from less then 1 or more than 8 attacks of migraine per month
* Patient had difficulty in distinguishing his/her migraine attacks from tension or interval headaches
* Patient had prior exposure to rizatriptan

outcomeMeasures.title: Pain Relief at 2 Hours During the First Migraine Attack Period
outcomeMeasures.description: Patients reporting pain relief defined as a reduction of headache severity from grades 2 or 3 (moderate or severe) at baseline to grades 0 or 1 (no headache or mild) at 2 hours after initial dosing for the first migraine attack

outcomeMeasures.title: Pain Relief at 2 Hours During the Second Migraine Attack Period
outcomeMeasures.description: Patients reporting pain relief defined as a reduction of headache severity from grades 2 or 3 (moderate or severe) to grades 0 or 1 (no headache or mild) at 2 hours after dosing for the second migraine attack

outcomeMeasures.title: Pain Relief at 2 Hours During the Third Migraine Attack Period
outcomeMeasures.description: Patients reporting pain relief defined as a reduction of headache severity from grades 2 or 3 (moderate or severe) to grades 0 or 1 (no headache or mild) at 2 hours after dosing for the third migraine attack

outcomeMeasures.title: Pain Relief at 2 Hours During the Fourth Migraine Attack Period
outcomeMeasures.description: Patients reporting pain relief defined as a reduction of headache severity from grades 2 or 3 (moderate or severe) to grades 0 or 1 (no headache or mild) at 2 hours after dosing for the fourth migraine attack
